content.title: Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities to Scheduled Castes by Establishing Livestock Units under Mukhya Mantri Antyodaya Parivaar Utthan Yojana
content.beneficiary: Unemployed residents of Haryana belonging to the Scheduled Caste category
content.details: The scheme is implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana. Under the scheme, an unemployed resident of Haryana belonging to the Scheduled Caste category can avail a subsidy for purchasing livestock. This subsidy will be provided after the establishment of the livestock units and can be availed as a loan by the beneficiary. The scheme covers the establishment of dairy units with 2 milch animals, 10+1 piggery units, and 15+1 sheep/goat units.
benefits: 50% subsidy on the cost of milch animals for establishing dairy units of 2 milch animals.
50% subsidy on the cost of livestock for establishing 10+1 piggery units, with a maximum amount of ₹50,000/- as financial assistance.
90% subsidy on the cost of livestock for establishing 15+1 sheep/goat units, with a maximum amount of ₹88,200/- as financial assistance.
Insurance assistance will be provided as per the available departmental scheme.
eligibility: The applicant should be 18 to 60 years of age and a resident of Haryana.
The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste category.
There are no mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements.
The applicant should have a space/shed for keeping animals.
The applicant would have to submit a Self-Declaration for being unemployed and for undertaking to abide by other conditions as required under the Scheme.
exclusions: Any group/firm/organization will not be permitted to apply under the Scheme, as the Scheme is individual beneficiary-oriented.
content.application_process: Offline and Online - via CSCs. Applicants should visit the Deputy Director's office in their district to collect the application form, fill it out, attach all relevant documents, and submit it to the concerned official.
documents_required: Copy of Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque
Photo of availability of shed/space for keeping animals

faqs.question: What is the main objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The main objective of the scheme is to provide employment opportunities to unemployed residents of Haryana belonging to the Scheduled Caste category by establishing livestock units.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligibility criteria include being an unemployed resident of Haryana, aged between 18 and 60, and belonging to the Scheduled Caste category.

faqs.question: What types of livestock units are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme covers the establishment of dairy units with 2 milch animals, 10+1 piggery units, and 15+1 sheep/goat units.

faqs.question: What is the subsidy provided for establishing dairy units?
faqs.answer: A 50% subsidy on the cost of milch animals is provided, which can be availed as a loan for purchasing the animals.

faqs.question: How much subsidy is provided for establishing piggery units?
faqs.answer: A 50% subsidy on the cost of livestock is provided for piggery units, with a maximum financial assistance of ₹50,000/-.

faqs.question: What subsidy is available for sheep/goat units?
faqs.answer: A 90% subsidy on the cost of livestock is provided for sheep/goat units, with a maximum financial assistance of ₹88,200/-.

faqs.question: Is there any financial assistance for insurance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, insurance assistance is provided as per the available departmental scheme, or beneficiaries must arrange and pay for the insurance premium themselves if no scheme is operational.

faqs.question: Are there any exclusions under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, groups, firms, or organizations are not permitted to apply as the scheme is intended for individual beneficiaries only.

faqs.question: Are there any educational qualifications required to apply?
faqs.answer: No, there are no mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements for applicants.

faqs.question: What are the age requirements for applicants?
faqs.answer: Applicants must be between 18 and 60 years of age.

faqs.question: What kind of space is required for keeping animals?
faqs.answer: Applicants must have space or a shed suitable for keeping the animals.

faqs.question: How can one apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail the benefits of the scheme, applicants should visit the Deputy Director's office in their district and collect the application form.
